body.p:
The State of Kentucky
Couty of Jefferson } S.S.

This day William Zimmerman made oath before me a Justice of the peace for said county that Christian Hoffner did on the day of 1862 in the City of Louisville Jefferson County Kentucky feloniously take steal and carry away from the said William Zimmerman one Gold watch and chain worth $70.00 the property of the said William Zimmerman also that the said Christian Hoffner, at the same time and place did feloniously, take, steal, and carry away from the said William Zimmerman one double cased silver watch worth $25.00 $37.50 in Gold coins of the United States $60.00 in Bank notes worth $60.00 and $3.00 in silver coin of the United States, one satin vest worth $10.00 seven shirts worth $20.00 all the property of the said William Zimmerman and that the said Christian Hoffner has since the Commission of said felony as afsd; been a fugitive from Justice (his wherabouts unknown until recently) and is now running at large in the state of Indiana
Subscribed and sworn to before me by William Zimmerman this 9th day of September 1863
Jos. Clement. J. P. J. C
Affidavit of William Zimmerman as to a felony Committed by Christian Hoffner

Jefferson County
Requisition issued 10th Sept 1863
And D. T. Bligh apptd Agent
